title: Authors and Citation
text: Claire Zippel. Maintainer. Matt Saenz. Author. Luis Nuñez. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Saenz M (2025). Rcbpp: R Utilities CBPP Research. R package version 0.10.3, https://centeronbudget.github.io/Rcbpp/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Rcbpp: R Utilities for CBPP Research},   author = {Matt Saenz},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.10.3},   url = {https://centeronbudget.github.io/Rcbpp/}, }

title: R Utilities for CBPP Research
text: R utilities streamline CBPP research, including functions generating commonly used variables, creating paths files SharePoint datasets library, computing basic weighted statistics. Rcbpp also includes data frequently come handy, including state FIPS codes (along corresponding state names postal abbreviations) calendar year averages CPI-U-RS.

title: R Utilities for CBPP Research
text: install Rcbpp, run following code:

title: R Utilities for CBPP Research
code: library(Rcbpp) library(tidyverse)  mar21 <- read_csv(   file = sp_cps_asec(2021, f = "csv"),   col_select = c(marsupwt, a_age, spm_resources, spm_povthreshold) )  mar21 |>   make_age_group_var("cps_asec") |>   mutate(     pop = TRUE,      b100 = spm_resources < spm_povthreshold   ) |>   group_by(age_group) |>   summarize(     across(c(pop, b100), \(x) wt_sum(x, wt = marsupwt)),      .groups = "drop"   ) |>   mutate(     across(c(pop, b100), round),      pov_rate = b100 / pop   ) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   age_group         pop     b100 pov_rate #>   <fct>           <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 Under 18     72777497  7044256   0.0968 #> 2 18 to 64    197582013 17446130   0.0883 #> 3 65 and over  55835929  5290704   0.0948  with(mar21, wt_quantile(a_age, wt = marsupwt, n = 10)) #> 10% 20% 30% 40% 50% 60% 70% 80% 90%  #>   8  16  24  31  38  46  54  62  71

title: CPI-U-RS — cpi_u_rs
text: dataset containing available R-CPI-U-RS (formerly CPI-U-RS) calendar year averages.

title: CPI-U-RS — cpi_u_rs
CPI-U-RS — cpi_u_rs
text: tibble two variables: year cpi_u_rs.

what: Run a Stata .do file in batch mode — do_stata
title: Run a Stata .do file in batch mode — do_stata
text: Run Stata .file batch mode command line. recommended install path Stata executable first stata_exe().

title: Run a Stata .do file in batch mode — do_stata
Run a Stata .do file in batch mode — do_stata
text: file path Stata .file. wd Working directory run .file. NULL, default, current working directory used. stata_exe path Stata executable. NULL, default, use STATA_EXE environment variable.

title: Run a Stata .do file in batch mode — do_stata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # Install the path to your Stata executable first stata_exe("YOUR STATA EXE") # Run a do file in batch mode do_stata("script.do")  # Run a do file in batch mode, specifying the Stata executable do_stata("script.do", stata_exe = "C:/Program Files/Stata17/StataMP-64.exe")  } # }

what: Convert a state FIPS code to a labeled factor — fct_statefips
title: Convert a state FIPS code to a labeled factor — fct_statefips
text: Convert state FIPS code labeled factor

title: Convert a state FIPS code to a labeled factor — fct_statefips
Convert a state FIPS code to a labeled factor — fct_statefips
text: x Vector state FIPS codes. x character vector, first coerced numeric. labels character string specifying label levels: "name" state names (default), "abbrv" state postal abbreviations.

title: Convert a state FIPS code to a labeled factor — fct_statefips
text: x labeled factor

title: Convert a state FIPS code to a labeled factor — fct_statefips
code: fips <- c(1, 6, 11, 48) fct_statefips(fips) #> [1] Alabama              California           District of Columbia #> [4] Texas                #> 57 Levels: Alabama Alaska Arizona Arkansas California Colorado ... U.S. Virgin Islands fct_statefips(fips, labels = "abbrv") #> [1] AL CA DC TX #> 57 Levels: AL AK AZ AR CA CO CT DE DC FL GA HI ID IL IN IA KS KY LA ME ... VI

what: Make an age group variable — make_age_group_var
title: Make an age group variable — make_age_group_var
text: make_age_group_var() creates 3-level age group variable ACS, CPS ASEC, basic monthly CPS microdata. Levels include 18, 18 64, 65 .

title: Make an age group variable — make_age_group_var
Make an age group variable — make_age_group_var
text: df Data frame add age group variable . dataset Dataset corresponding df. One "acs", "cps_asec", "cps_basic". name Name give age group variable. Defaults "age_group".

title: Make an age group variable — make_age_group_var
text: data frame.

title: Make an age group variable — make_age_group_var
text: ACS, years 2005 present supported required variable agep. CPS ASEC, survey years 1998 present supported required variable a_age. basic monthly CPS, years 1998 present supported required variable prtage.

title: Make an age group variable — make_age_group_var
text: function designed work original, Census-based ACS CPS microdata. (opposed Census microdata processed , example, IPUMS.) Therefore, prior using function ensure data behaving according official data dictionary.

title: Make a race/ethnicity variable — make_race_eth_var
text: make_race_eth_var() creates 5-level race/ethnicity variable ACS, CPS ASEC, basic monthly CPS microdata. Levels include white , Latino; Black , Latino; Latino (race); Asian , Latino; another race multi-racial, Latino.

title: Make a race/ethnicity variable — make_race_eth_var
Make a race/ethnicity variable — make_race_eth_var
text: df Data frame add race/ethnicity variable . dataset Dataset corresponding df. One "acs", "cps_asec", "cps_basic". name Name give race/ethnicity variable. Defaults "race_eth".

title: Make a race/ethnicity variable — make_race_eth_var
text: data frame.

title: Make a race/ethnicity variable — make_race_eth_var
text: ACS, years 2005 present supported required variables rac1p hisp. CPS ASEC, survey years 2003 present supported required variables prdtrace pehspnon. basic monthly CPS, years 2003 present supported required variables ptdtrace pehspnon.

title: Make a race/ethnicity variable — make_race_eth_var
text: function designed work original, Census-based ACS CPS microdata. (opposed Census microdata processed , example, IPUMS.) Therefore, prior using function ensure data behaving according official data dictionary.

what: Create paths to files in a synced datasets library — sp_data
title: Create paths to files in a synced datasets library — sp_data
text: Functions creating paths files synced datasets library. functions designed simple compact.

title: Create paths to files in a synced datasets library — sp_data
code: sp_acs(y, f)  sp_cps_asec(y, f)  sp_cps_basic(y, m, f)

title: Create paths to files in a synced datasets library — sp_data
text: y One years. f Format data. One "csv", "dta", "parquet". m One months (specified numerically).

title: Create paths to files in a synced datasets library — sp_data
text: character vector containing created file paths.

title: Create paths to files in a synced datasets library — sp_data
text: functions create one file paths based sp_data_path() directory structure file naming convention dataset library. functions verify whether resulting files actually exist.

title: Create paths to files in a synced datasets library — sp_data
text: like request sp_*() function dataset use frequently, please file issue GitHub.

what: Create a path to SharePoint and OneDrive directories — sp_path
title: Create a path to SharePoint and OneDrive directories — sp_path
text: sp_path() creates path directory synced SharePoint folders. sp_data_path() creates start path synced datasets library. od_path() creates path user's OneDrive. functions verify whether resulting directories actually exist.

title: Create a path to SharePoint and OneDrive directories — sp_path
code: sp_data_path(path = NULL)  od_path(path = NULL)  sp_path(path = NULL)

title: Create a path to SharePoint and OneDrive directories — sp_path
text: path Unique file path string. Defaults NULL.

title: Create a path to SharePoint and OneDrive directories — sp_path
text: character vector length one (invisibly).

what: Install the path to your Stata executable in your .Renviron file — stata_exe
title: Install the path to your Stata executable in your .Renviron file — stata_exe
text: function add path Stata executable .Renviron file. installed Stata path, can called time Sys.getenv("STATA_EXE"). do_stata() automatically use STATA_EXE running .files batch mode.

title: Install the path to your Stata executable in your .Renviron file — stata_exe
Install the path to your Stata executable in your .Renviron file — stata_exe
text: path Path Stata executable install Install path .Renviron file use future sessions overwrite Overwrite existing STATA_EXE already .Renviron file

title: Install the path to your Stata executable in your .Renviron file — stata_exe
text: .Renviron file, function create one . already .Renviron file, function append key existing file, making backup original file disaster recovery purposes.

title: Install the path to your Stata executable in your .Renviron file — stata_exe
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  stata_exe("C:/Program Files/Stata17/StataMP-64.exe", install = TRUE) # After first installation, reload your environment or restart R readRenviron("~/.Renviron")  } # }

title: State FIPS codes — state_fips
text: dataset containing state FIPS codes along corresponding state names postal abbreviations.

title: State FIPS codes — state_fips
State FIPS codes — state_fips
text: tibble three variables: state_fips, state_abbrv, state_name.

title: Compute basic weighted statistics — wt_stats
text: Functions computing basic weighted statistics. functions designed strict, consistent, useful within dplyr::summarize().

title: Compute basic weighted statistics — wt_stats
code: wt_sum(x, wt)  wt_mean(x, wt)  wt_median(x, wt)  wt_quantile(x, wt, n)

title: Compute basic weighted statistics — wt_stats
text: x logical numeric vector. wt numeric vector weights length x. n numeric vector length one (.e., number) giving number equally sized groups split x . Note n groups, n - 1 quantiles (.e., cut points). Quantiles currently supported include median (n = 2), quartiles (n = 4), quintiles (n = 5), deciles (n = 10), ventiles (n = 20).

title: Compute basic weighted statistics — wt_stats
text: except wt_quantile(), numeric vector length one. wt_quantile(), named numeric vector length n - 1 unless NA values present x wt, case numeric vector length one (containing NA) returned.

title: Compute basic weighted statistics — wt_stats
text: NA values present x wt, functions return NA. wt must contain negative values. wt may contain values zero must contain values zero.

what: Remove all Stata dataset attributes from a data frame — zap_stata
title: Remove all Stata dataset attributes from a data frame — zap_stata
text: zap_stata() removes Stata dataset attributes data frame created via haven::read_dta(). function meant cut repetitive code associated importing DTA file CSV file readily available. name function nod haven::zap_*() functions.

title: Remove all Stata dataset attributes from a data frame — zap_stata
Remove all Stata dataset attributes from a data frame — zap_stata
text: df data frame.

title: Remove all Stata dataset attributes from a data frame — zap_stata
text: data frame.

title: Remove all Stata dataset attributes from a data frame — zap_stata
text: specifically, zap_stata(): Removes value labels converts tagged missing values NA. Removes variable labels formats. Removes dataset label. Removes dataset notes.

title: Rcbpp 0.10.3
text: Hot fix sp_* functions (#28)

title: Rcbpp 0.10.2
text: cpi_u_rs dataset updated latest available figures, calendar year 2023.

title: Rcbpp 0.10.1
text: cpi_u_rs dataset updated latest available figures, calendar year 2022.

title: Rcbpp 0.10.0
text: Added do_stata(), function execute Stata .files batch mode R. Helper function stata_exe() stores path user’s Stata executable .Renviron use do_stata(). Added fct_statefips(), function converting numeric vector state FIPS codes labeled factor.

title: Rcbpp 0.9.4
text: New functions sp_path od_path construct paths user’s SharePoint OneDrive directories, respectively. sp_data_path new name make_sp_data_path. old function name retained throw warning. cpi_u_rs dataset updated latest available figures, calendar year 2021.
